page.title: 02A FARM SURVEY NEAR ST.IVES
page.content: We surveyed the seven family farms to the west of St Ives on the flat coastal strip between the moorland and the cliffs. The 4{dairy}and 3{beef}farms have an average size of 126 acres,with 122 cattle. The 4 milking herds (Guernsey, Fresian and Ayrshires) are between 60-70 head. Milk is sent to the Unigate dairy at St Erth. The main crops are grass and fodder. Silage is made for winter feed.On dairy farms the cattle are kept in at this time. No farm has more than 2 full_time workers (apart from family).Each has at least 3 tractors. Three farms grow broccoli and potatoes and sell them locally.Four farms have camping or flats for tourists.Two others do contracting for other farms.
